header.article_title: Behind the scenes: What led to Cyrus Mistry ouster
header.author: Divit Koradia

body.image: Cyrus Mistry pondering as to why he didn't come up with a new Tata Indica
body.p: Tata Group Headqauter'sTata Indica is a supermini car produced by Tata Motors (who are a part of Tata Group, which is a multinational conglomerate holding company, headquartered in India). The Indica is India’s first indigenously developed passenger car in 1998 and was unveiled by Ratan Tata (ex, now interim, chairman of Tata Group).

During his time as CEO, Ratan Tata had made great endeavours to promote the Indica as the best reasonable priced hatchback for the common man. In fact, Tata motors were so focused on reinventing the Indica that they forgot about producing and launching different cars like every other sane automobile company would do. For 17 years, they kept on remaking and relaunching the Tata Indica with new names like Indica V1, Indica V2, Vista V2 etc. However, things changed when Cyrus Mistry didn’t bother upgrading the Indica which has been the status symbol for the Tatas since years. Cyrus turned a blind-eye towards the company’s rich heritage of remaking the Indica and that is why the board decided to bring back the experienced ex-chairman Ratan Tata on board.

Rumours are surfacing that Ratan Tata’s first big project is to design a new and exciting model of the Indica, which will help recall the value of the Tata brand and get their customer’s excited once again.
For now, it is ‘Tata’ for Cyrus Mistry!
